title: What is RCM in GST? - Quora
tags: Goods and Services Tax in India

response.answer_text: In normal case GST is charged by supplier to his customer in the invoice and the same is then paid to the government after adjusting input tax credits. However there are certain cases where in the receiver of goods or services is required to pay GST on the amount of Goods or services received by him. Such payment is called payment made under Reverse Charge Mechanism (RCM) The recipient of the service is required to pay the tax at the rate which is applicable to the respective goods or services. The recipient is required to prepare a payment voucher in which all the necessary information about the tax is to be filled up to be uploaded while filing the return. GST is required to be paid under RCM in following situations: 1) When the government notifies specific categories of supply of goods or services on which tax shall be paid on reverse charge basis by the recipient of such goods or services. . Sec 9(3) 2) When a registered person receives taxable goods or services from a person who is not registered then receiver of goods or services is required to pay GST on such goods or services as per taxes applicable to such goods or services. Sec 9(4) - However, this has been kept in abeyance and at present it is not applicable. It is expected to come in force for selective persons receiving supply of goods or services. 3) Importer is required to pay IGST on the imports made by him. This is also a type of reverse tax.

RCM in GST is reverse charge mechanism where recipient of goods and services is liable to pay GST as if he is a supplier as provided for in Section 9(3) of CGST Act,2017. For example, GST is to be paid by the recipient in case of goods like cotton, tobacco leaves etc and services like GTA, advocate services, security services,import services etc. Please refer to notification no.4/2017-CT(R) for the list of goods that are liable to be paid on RCM basis. Similarly please refer to Notification No.13/2017-CT(R) for services on which GST is to be paid on RCM basis. Further, recipient of cement and construction related goods and services received from unregistered suppliers are also notified under 7/2019-CTR dt 29.3.2019 issued in terms of new Section 9(4) that is substituted through GST Taxation Amendment Act,2018 in place of earlier Section 9(4) of the CGST Act,2017 for the purpose of payment of GST on RCM basis by the builders who opt to pay GST @5% on construction service. Please note that except for goods and services as mentioned above, purchases of goods and services by registered person from unregistered suppliers do not attract RCM payment under Section 9(4) at present.
